intro: Alsomitra angustipetala, commonly known as the narrow-leaved alsomitra, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is a climbing vine characterized by its slender stems and compound leaves with elongated, narrow leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are followed by berries that turn red when mature. Native to Southeast Asia, it thrives in humid, tropical environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within its genus.
